Tim, I had an idea that might or might not be a good idea..
For the early man rated part just mount a crew Dragon and trunk on top of the starship. Starship is huge and wouldn't mind the extra weight and it would give them a proven escape capability. They could then man the starship much earlier and I think safer. They could undock, turn around and dock to a hatch to give crew access to the main cabin. Crew dragon already knows how to dock so no development is required. It also gives them a way home if starship is still in it's ify reentry stage. It would obviously add cost to a launch, but it might speed up the timeline,or not. Just a thought.

Just wondering could final Starship on top of planned heavy booster save enough fuel to do similar re entry as Falcon 9 first stage and not need a heat shield or much less of one? Sure the fuel needed would lower payload but maybe could still put up Falcon 9 or Falcon Heavy like payloads? Would be option if heat shield technology becomes delaying issue? Heat shield not needed Falcon 9 first stage due to re entry burn. While an orbiting vehicle much faster and needs shield moving 5 miles a second if enough fuel could kill off that speed before hit atmosphere and require maybe no shield or one much easier to design.
